availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Redmon (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lucinda Ramsey in Clark County, Kentucky, on July 25, 1827. Father of Mary Redmon Bush, Eliza Redmon, Thomas Redmon, Edmund Redmon, James Redmon, and Mary E. Redmon. Farmer in Clark County in 1850. Owned seventeen enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Owned thirteen enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860. Reported as the owner of John Redmon, Daniel Redmon, George Redmon, and Spencer Redmon, upon their enlistment in the United States Colored Troops at Camp Nelson, Jessamine County, in 1864.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 212, 215.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 329B-330A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Blue Ball, p. 15A-B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film 001943687, p. 223.
Descriptive Lists of Volunteers, 1864, Records of the Adjutant General’s Office, NARA RG 94, M858, Volume 59.
